TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BestWorkerMode extends Azure.Communication.JobRouter.DistributionMode

Docs.summary: Jobs are distributed to the worker with the strongest abilities available.

MemberSignature.Value: public BestWorkerMode (int minConcurrentOffers = 1, int maxConcurrentOffers = 1, bool bypassSelectors = false, bool sortDescending = true);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 minConcurrentOffers, int32 maxConcurrentOffers, bool bypassSelectors, bool sortDescending) cil managed
Public Sub New (Optional minConcurrentOffers As Integer = 1, Optional maxConcurrentOffers As Integer = 1, Optional bypassSelectors As Boolean = false, Optional sortDescending As Boolean = true)

Docs.param: Governs the minimum desired number of active concurrent offers a job can have. By default, set to 1.
Governs the maximum number of active concurrent offers a job can have. By default, set to 1.

(Optional) If set to true, then router will match workers to jobs even if they do not match label selectors. Default, set to false. Warning: You may get workers that are not qualified for the job they are matched with if you set this variable to true. This flag is intended more for temporary usage.
(Optional) If false, will sort scores by ascending order. By default, set to true.
Docs.summary:
Initializes a new instance of BestWorkerModePolicy with default scoring rule.
Default scoring formula that uses the number of job labels that the worker labels match, as well as the number of label selectors the worker labels match and/or exceed using a logistic function (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logistic_function).

MemberSignature.Value: public BestWorkerMode (Azure.Communication.JobRouter.RouterRule scoringRule, System.Collections.Generic.IList<Azure.Communication.JobRouter.ScoringRuleParameterSelector> scoringParameterSelectors = default, bool bypassSelectors = false, bool allowScoringBatchOfWorkers = false, int? batchSize = default, bool sortDescending = true, int minConcurrentOffers = 1, int maxConcurrentOffers = 1);

new Azure.Communication.JobRouter.BestWorkerMode : Azure.Communication.JobRouter.RouterRule * System.Collections.Generic.IList<Azure.Communication.JobRouter.ScoringRuleParameterSelector> * bool * bool * Nullable<int> * bool * int * int -> Azure.Communication.JobRouter.BestWorkerMode
MemberSignature.Usage: new Azure.Communication.JobRouter.BestWorkerMode (scoringRule, scoringParameterSelectors, bypassSelectors, allowScoringBatchOfWorkers, batchSize, sortDescending, minConcurrentOffers, maxConcurrentOffers)

Docs.param: Defines a scoring rule to use, when calculating a score to determine the best worker.
(Optional) List of that will be sent as part of the payload to scoring rule.

(Optional) If set to true, then router will match workers to jobs even if they do not match label selectors. Default, set to false. Warning: You may get workers that are not qualified for the job they are matched with if you set this variable to true. This flag is intended more for temporary usage.
(Optional) If true, will try to obtain scores for a batch of workers. By default, set to false.
(Optional) Set batch size when 'allowScoringBatchOfWorkers' is set to true to control batch size of workers to
(Optional) If false, will sort scores by ascending order. By default, set to true.
Governs the minimum desired number of active concurrent offers a job can have. By default, set to 1.
Governs the maximum number of active concurrent offers a job can have. By default, set to 1.
Docs.summary:
Initializes a new instance of BestWorkerModePolicy with user-specified scoring rule.
Default scoring formula that uses the number of job labels that the worker labels match, as well as the number of label selectors the worker labels match and/or exceed using a logistic function (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logistic_function).

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ScoringRule : Azure.Communication.JobRouter.RouterRule with get, set

Docs.summary:
A rule of one of the following types:
StaticRule: A rule providing static rules that always return the same result, regardless of input. DirectMapRule: A rule that return the same labels as the input labels. ExpressionRule: A rule providing inline expression rules. AzureFunctionRule: A rule providing a binding to an HTTP Triggered Azure Function. Please note is the base class. According to the scenario, a derived class of the base class might need to be assigned here, or this property needs to be casted to one of the possible derived classes. The available derived classes include , , and .
Encapsulates all options that can be passed as parameters for scoring rule with BestWorkerMode.
